comment: I really miss you Professor House you are a great man great Professor I ever had.
PROFESSOR HOUSE WAS A GREAT MAN. HE WILL BE MISSED. RIP PROFESSOR HOUSE

Dr. House was such a sweet caring man that only wanted the best for his students.You could tell that he was a great man & a wonderful teacher.He really cared for each of his students.I am honored to have had him in his last days.I know he is happy now & is where he deserves to be watching over us all.Rest In Peace Dr. James House.You will be missed
Rip house! You will never be replaced! We miss you already!  -your spsu math students
RIP Professor House!!
Absolutely amazing professor that really had a passion about math. He will be sorely missed. RIP.
RIP, House! You will be missed dearly!
Professor James House died this morning of a heart attack. He will be missed.

Very easy professor. Gives you a thorough review sheet before exam and allows a cheat sheet! He gave me an A (I probably deserved a C+) bc he saw my dedication. Only draw back is he does make errors, but what math professor doesn't? He also accidentally runs his nails on the chalk board all the time when writing problems and it hurts my ears so badly I had to leave early once!

Don't take Dr.House regardless of how cool his name sounds. He doesn't know his stuff. He goes to the board and rambles. And loose his train of thought constantly. He frequently messes up while working problems and only gives 5 test. No quizzes. And hone work only counts for 10% of your grade.

Possibly the worst teacher I have ever come across. Prof House just could not explain the material very coherently. Forced to drop the class out of fear of failure. He had a tendency to write on the chalk board and stand right in front of what he's writing so you can't see a bleeping thing while he's covering it. Waste of my time and money.
Very good at discussing the different applications of the material covered.

He is a very nice man but sadly being a nice person doesn't make you a good teacher. He is unclear in his explanations and does not repeat problems for the class to understand how to do them. He tends to jump through problems because he does not come prepared to class with actual problems. Because of this he struggles to solve them in real time.

I just took Discrete Math, Summer 09    This Professor is knowledgeable but he can?t teach. I think Professor House has a big heart for students that are trying. I found that the one on one time with him is good. However, his deliver of the material is not clear and he gets confused himself. As a result you end up struggling on what should be eas

PROFESSOR IS A HORRIBLE TEACHER. HE CANT TEACH AND CAN TELL HE IS LAZY CAUSE HE DOESN'T REQUIRE TO TAKE UP HOMEWORK. IF HE KNOWS U ARE GOING TO FAIL HE WILL TELL U U CAN DROP CLASS SO HE WONT HAVE A HIGH FAILURE RATE. I THINK HE IS A LITTLE TO OLD TO BE TEACHING AND NEEDS TO GIVE IT UP.

I really like Dr. House.  He is a really nice guy.  I curves the grade.  If he knows you are trying hard, he will make sure you pass with at least a C.  However, he needs to improve a little on his teaching skills.  Sometimes his points weren't clear.  He's always there to help.  Me and him were best buds by the end of the semester, and I passed.

House is definitely an easy teacher... I recommend if you want an easy A. I will, however, say that he's not that great at getting his point across and is very easily distracted. If you don't feel comfortable with the math... take another teacher.
This dude is the shizzle!! Man can get you an easy A or B. Failed his first test cuz I didn't care, but when it came from push to shove. I aced the rest.
I liked him, he is def easy. He helps u out a lot if u need. Not a bad choice of a professor.

Old man who definitely needs to retire. Nice guy, but cannot teach math. He is very smart, but he expects for all of his students to follow him. He lectures in Math... Math is not about lecturing.. it is about doing problems over and over again.
He is the best ever, super cool and good friend. You really will learn, if I do, you can.

If you want an easy A/B, House is your man. If you want to actually learn the course material, STAY AWAY!! You will most likely fail at least 75% of his tests but still end up with at least a B due to his curving.
Excellent - explains concepts in simplest fashion possible - no gobbledegook
Cool as Hell!! Very understanding when it comes to effort!!  Best math teacher ever, consider taking his course!!

PROF. HOUSE WAS BY FAR THE BEST MATH TEACHER I HAVE EVER HAD!  HIS CALSSES ARE NOT VERY CLEAR, BUT HE IS GREAT WITH ONE ON ONE TEACHING AFTER CLASS.  HE RECOGNIZES IF A STUDENT IS REALLY TRYING AND REWARDS THEM ACCORDINGLY.  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND HIM IF YOU ARE GOING TO TRY HARD. IF YOU WANT AN EASY WAY OUT, DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS.

Prof. House is understanding and works with his students to make sure that they understand the core of the class. He is always available for his students before and after class.  I would attend any of his classes in the future.

Dr. House is an old professor way past his prime. His soft voice and tedious lectures make his clarity zero and his lectures are painful to sit through. Fortunately, he lets you use a calculator on the test and use one sheet of notes, multiple for the final. I would not reccomend his class unless your patience is very high.
very confussing. he knows his stuff but puts thing in far off consepts. does let you have a cheat sheet for the test and it is a goog thing because the test r hard. got a B.
Absent minded, and he had the WORST T/A EVER! He is VERY easy on the grades, tho.

This is the best math teacher at southern poly and im only a freshman. He's not like other teachers who would count off all points for missing a decimal or something of that nature. he is very easy on grading and understands how we think.
He is the worst teacher ever. He is too smart and can't communicate. I corrected him ever day of that class, and it was one the simple stuff. He will confuss you becasue he makes easy stuff hard.

HE IS A VERY SMART MAN BUT TO SMART FOR HIS OWN GOOD.  HE TEACHES YOU ONE THING THEN CONFUSE YOU THE NEXT WITH HIM TRYING TO EXPLAIN IT USING CALCULUS TO A ALGEBRA @ TRIGONOMETRY CLASS BUT OVERALL HE ALRIGHT

This is the best math teacher at SOuthern Polytechnic.  His tests are easy, you get to use a cheat sheet.  His grading is excellent.  I know Calc. 2 is hard but he makes it easy.  No one will fail, those are his remarks.  The whole class almost got A's.
He is very lenient in his grading and expectations, so the class itself is fairly easy if you put forth half an effort.
